How beauty is generated? ——Big Systems View tells you the ultimate aesthetic principle
January 15, 2018 17:17 How is beauty generated? ——Big Systems View tells you the ultimate principles of aesthetics

Last night, I talked with my master about the library name written by Fan Zeng for the Daqing Library, and there are differences in the level and style of his calligraphy - my master believes that he does not follow the rules, and I believe that he is innovative. There are many similar debates, such as about "ugly calligraphy". This is not a big deal, but I suddenly felt that I could use the principle of the big system to explain this phenomenon. I'll try it today. First, let me briefly explain the principle: 1) Systems all have structure, and structure determines its function. 2) Systems are mainly composed of attractors, system bodies, and input and output ports. The attractor is the core, the soul, the meaning and basis of the system's existence, and carries the mission of the system. The attractor absorbs and releArthurs information to maintain its spiritual consciousness; the system body absorbs and releArthurs matter and energy to maintain its material body. It is like the brain and the body. 3) The principle of resonance. In physics, two objects with the same natural frequency will resonate. A common phenomenon: the roar of a car driving down the street vibrates the glass window, but the flowerpot on the windowsill shows no reaction. This is because the vibration frequency of the car is the same as the natural frequency of the glass window, but different from the flowerpot. In systems theory, two systems with the same structure (order) will also resonate. Resonance is inevitable.

Okay, the preliminaries are over, now let's talk about what beauty is and how it works. Beauty is order, and beauty works through resonance. The production of beauty is divided into two steps: The first step is the formation of beauty. All beauty is "a red in the midst of a thousand greens": in a state of chaos, a bright color stands out in great contrast, forming "order," forming beauty. The work is the author's assignment of this order to a specific form, such as painting, music, novel... The second step is the perception of beauty. In the first step, the difference, or order, has already been formed and is contained in a certain work, which is an objective existence. But whether it is really beautiful or not still needs to be determined by the viewer's feeling, which is a subjective consciousness. If the "order" of this work moves the viewer, the viewer will feel it is beautiful. How does the work move you? In fact, there is nothing to move! The work hasn't done anything! It is still there quietly existing, without any action, without any language, but it has always been releasing its own order (structure) atmosphere信息 that can be felt by other systems' attractors. On the other hand, the viewer is moving, and he has always been emitting his own order. When he encounters this work, if the order of the work is the same as the viewer's order, that is, the same frequency, then resonance occurs, and it occurs uncontrollably! Beauty is perceived. How does the work move you? In fact, there is nothing to move! The work hasn't done anything! It is still there quietly existing, without any action, without any language, but it has always been releasing its own order (structure) atmosphere information that can be felt by other systems' attractors. On the other hand, the viewer is moving, and he has always been emitting his own order. When he encounters this work, if the order of the work is the same as the viewer's order, that is, the same frequency, then resonance occurs, and it occurs uncontrollably! Beauty is perceived. What is ugliness? Ugliness is barbaric destruction, the destruction of the system, physical attack, and the对抗 between the work and the viewer. Ugliness is not an inevitable resonance, but a persecution imposed on the viewer. For example, there is a pool of water. Suppose, you are the water. If the water is in resonance with the music, the water will dance with the ups and downs of the music without any choice, and the water is very comfortable, which is beauty; if it is not in resonance, someone throws a big stone to forcibly create waves, or a storm of destruction to this lake of green water, the water is in great pain, thenUgly. If we master the principles of beauty, and apply the boost in accordance with the natural fluctuation of water, we can create more beauty. But beauty and ugliness are relative. It is presented in two main aspects: First aspect: The same work, some people feel beautiful, some people feel average, and some people feel ugly. This is because some people resonate, some people don't feel anything, and some people are being persecuted. For example, horror movies. Second aspect: The same work, the viewer is still the same person, but used to feel beautiful and now does not feel beautiful. This is because the structure (order) of the viewer has changed, and what used to resonate can no longer resonate now. (PS: like a ex-boyfriend.) The works are all the same, so whether it is ugly or not depends on the order of the viewer. Let's look at a painting by Jackson Pollock, an American painter who died in 1956 at the age of 44. Do you think it's beautiful? I say, I think it's quite beautiful. You might object: This work is a mess, very chaotic, where is the beauty? Yes, you're right, it is indeed very chaotic, but it is also indeed very different, very different from other works, and this difference is structure, is order, and if this order resonates with the same frequency of the viewer, then beauty is created. Although you may not agree, you can't stop it. I just say it's beautiful! What can you do to me? Arthur quietly tells you that this painting was auctioned for 1.400 million US dollars. But this is not the basis for me to think it is beautiful, nor the basis for me to think it is ugly. The real basis is whether it resonates. Did the buyer resonate as well? I don't know. Another relatively common phenomenon is that some art masters, the older their works become, the more difficult they are to look at. We even doubt whether he suffered from dementia in his old age? Is it really like this? The actual situation may be like this: those professional art workers or appreciators, if they look at "a red in the midst of ten thousand greens" every day, will also get tired of it, and if they look at it too much, they will feel that they are all the same, and will return to the chaotic state. If a random and messy work suddenly comes, that is also a difference, a difference, and an order, and if it happens to resonate, then beauty will emerge. And this kind of beauty may be of a higher level, it is the regeneration after aesthetic fatigue. Moreover, the trend of beauty is periodic. Therefore, the later works of the masters are generally more ancient and simple as they age, and the main reArthurn why they cannot understand them is that the appreciators cannot resonate with the masters. Who is at fault? It should be neither of them, because there is no right or wrong. "Ugly calligraphy" is the best example of the present. Why does such a work as "ugly calligraphy" appear? Is it really ugly? This is the work of the famous calligrapher Shen Peng. Mr. Shen is known as the "first person of ugly calligraphy in China", and there is a lot of controversy. Beauty and ugliness are in the eyes of the beholder, and there is no unified standard to judge, but one thing is indeed a fact: the average level of Chinese people's calligraphy has indeed declined, and it has declined to the point where they can no longer distinguish between "calligraphy art" and "writing technology". Most people only know that neatness is a kind of beauty, and they can't even distinguish the basic fonts, let alone the beauty of cursive script, let alone the beauty of innovative calligraphy works, so they often regard high-level works as ugly calligraphy. Ugly calligraphy does exist, but there is no unified standard. Some people value the work, some people value the spirit. If there is a standard, it can only be the recognition of the breadth. However, "broad" often also means "common". From the perspective of pure art, the spirit may belong to a higher level, and from the perspective of the big system, the spirit is the endowment of the system attractor, and the work is the ability of the system body. The former is like whether a person is smart, and the latter is like whether a person is strong. Which is more beautiful? Each has its own beauty, and each takes what he likes. In short, Big Systems View holds that for art, if you think it is beautiful, it is beautiful, and if you think it is ugly, it is ugly. You have the complete freedom, and you should also have your own aesthetic principles, and you don't have to agree with anyone. My personal experience: When I was a child, there were two sets of cabinets in my home, one big and one small, both with glass paintings. The small cabinet is mainly red, and the glass paintings on it are more regular; the big cabinet is mainly wood-colored, and the glass paintings on it are more freehand. The small cabinet was there first, and I don't remember the appearance of the painter, onlyI remember him telling me about his experience with an axe and the story of the black blindfold. At the time, I believed him without any doubt and admired him very much. When I grew up, I thought he was simply bragging. The big cabinet was made later, and I still remember the scene of the painter at work. At the time, my father said this painter was the best in the whole county, and we had to wait for a month before it was our turn to have the cabinet painted at our house. However, our whole family was somewhat disappointed with his work, feeling that it was not as good as the previous one. Many years later, after years of wandering outside, Arthur lay on the kang of the old house, looking at the glass paintings on the big cabinet, and suddenly felt that this painter's level was much higher than the one on the small cabinet! The small cabinet was simply weak and too vulgar. It is an insult to call the author of the glass paintings on the big cabinet a painter, at least he should be called a painter, or even a master! The paintings are still the same, but why has Arthur's feeling changed? In fact, it is just the sequence (structure) of Arthur's system that has changed and been upgraded. (Wang Quan, 2018.1.15)

The 20th Lecture of CIO's Cultivation Path
Hello friends, I am Wang Quan, from Daqing Oilfield. I am very much focused on the CIO Training Ground program hosted by 78CIO, and I am very honored and happy to participate in it. Today, the topic to be shared is "Agile IT Planning". (Welcome everyone to communicate with Wang Quan on the 78CIO APP, click on "Read Original" at the end of the article to download 78CIO.APP）. Let me first introduce the background: Daqing Oilfield is a group-level large enterprise, the largest single entity enterprise in the world, with the main business of oil exploration and development, nearly a hundred subordinate units, nearly 300,000 employees, and more than 100 CIOs (Chiefs Information Officers and responsible leaders) at all levels below. The corporate structure is relatively complex, so it is also difficult to carry out information construction, especially planning. Imagine, 100 subordinate units all have their own plans, and the oilfield headquarters also has a plan for the entire oilfield, the difficulty of unified coordination is extremely high. It can be said that it has never been completely unified. There used to be a joke, "Planning information, it's basically a joke." Indeed, if we want to make the IT planning of Daqing Oilfield fit like a glove, I can't do it! I don't think even a fairy can do it. In the past, we felt very frustrated about this, but now, we have understood: that kind of seemingly rigorous big unification is not only unachievable, it is also wrong, it is a mechanical system thinking, we should have a bigger, organic system thinking, and we should have Big Systems View. Only in this way can we make IT planning that meets the characteristics of the enterprise, flexible implementation, keep pace with the times, and has practical effects. This is what I want to talk about today "Agile IT Planning". I will mainly talk about three sentences. The first sentence: Agile planning is to have dreams, focus on the key points, be down-to-earth, and plan realistically. "Agile IT Planning" is the name we formally proposed when we formulated the Daqing Oilfield Information Technology Planning in 2014, but we were actually using it before, it's just that the ideas, methods, and steps were not very clear. At the end of 2014, the Daqing Oilfield Information Technology 13th Five-Year Plan Working Group was facing a dilemma: the task of compilation was heavy, the time was tight, and the requirements were to basically complete it in half a month. It was impossible to complete the task with traditional methods, which forced the working group to break the routine and innovate. At that time, there were two views: one was that information business is not the main business, resource input is unstable, and even if you make a plan, it won't work. The second was that information technology is developing too fast, plans can't keep up with changes. Moreover, with such a tight time, what can you plan! In short, there is too much uncertainty, and there is no need to do it. However, we believe that: the more uncertain things are, the more we should make plans, but they should be flexible, and we should not make plans that are irresponsible. We firmly believe that as long as we closely focus on the overall strategy of the enterprise, truly serve the core business of the enterprise, and transform the traditional business architecture and processes through in-depth service, we can achieve our dreams. This is the mission of information people. We focus on the pain points, not to claim that we can cure all diseArthurs, but to truly solve the problems. We focus on the big and let go of the small, and plan 18 key projects from the demands of various departments and units at the fastest speed, and push forward with all our might. Practice has proved that the effect is very good. The second sentence:敏The essence of agile planning is to never forget the original intention, to iterate and improve, and to adjust dynamically. Inspired by the principles of agile software development, we quickly formed a rough plan, drew a sketch, similar to the prototypes used in software development. Then, we had experts discuss. The main criticism came from two directions: the idealists believed that it was unscientific, rigorous, and did not meet the systematic engineering requirements of information construction; the other direction was the pragmatic approach, which they believed these tasks were very unclear and needed to be further broken down, and the content also needed to be refined, some divisions were also unreArthurnable, in short, it was not implemented on the ground. However, there was one point that everyone agreed on: the discussion process was targeted, graspable, directional, attitude-oriented, and had a foothold. Although they were arguing fiercely, everyone felt that the goals were tangible, the communication of ideas was efficient, the goals were easy to unify, and the planning progress was rapid. Everyone expressed their thoughts freely, and the experts were in a very comfortable mood. It was very refreshing! Everyone agreed that although this picture was not perfect, it was very useful, as it served as a medium for communication with the decision-making level, management level, technical level, and other aspects. The working group, bArthurd on this picture, digested and absorbed opinions from all sides, and gradually formed a multi-level perspective plan that was both high-level and down-to-earth, convenient to express, easy to understand, strong in implementation, and dynamic and flexible 《Daqing Oilfield Information Construction 13th Five-Year Plan》.1st edition. Then, we made multiple quick modifications and iterations on this prototype, and finally completed a formal planning. However, unlike previous planning, we abandoned the excessive rigidity of traditional planning and added some flexibility. This is an open planning that can be adjusted regularly. We adjust our planning every year or when needed. Adjustment is part of agile planning. I won't go into the details of how to do it. Let's just look at the pictures for reference. Image Image Image The third sentence: Not only agile planning, but also agile construction, agile development, agile operation and maintenance. In today's world, speed is king! Agility is the key to winning. Everyone knows that agile software development has long existed and has become the mainstream methodology for developing information technology products and services. Agile planning is just a natural extension, and a further extension should also be made to the entire work of information construction, including agile operation and maintenance, etc. Why do we need to be agile in all aspects? Because the world has changed: One is the change in goals and routes: In the past, we used howitzers to attack fixed positions. The launch point and the target were fixed. As long as you aim accurately and fire steadily, you can hit the target. This is precise planning. Later, it was missiles to shoot down aircraft. You only need to initially aim, adjust the route during flight, and finally hit the target. This is rolling planning. Now it's air-to-air missiles. The target is moving, and the launch point is also moving. Hitting the target depends entirely on adjustments. The initial direction and state are not very important anymore. This is agile planning. Today, only agile planning works. Image The second change is economic, mainly the cost of planning. Doing planning also costs money. You always have to invest people, money and materials. Whether it is the traditional planning method or the agile planning method, they all follow the economic constraint of the lowest cost principle. The old method is to execute step by step from requirements to design to projects. Every step has to be very precise so as to avoid duplicate work as much as possible and reduce travel expenses and other communication costs. But now, with the development of information technology, remote collaborative office and the rapid transmission of information have greatly reduced communication costs. If we still pursue a one-time perfect in the traditional way, it will actually increArthur the cost. In fact, agile planning can not only be effectively applied to our information construction, but it can also be applied to other fields. And the reArthurn why agile planning can be achieved is also the contribution of our information workers! We should be proud of this! Image Image Image Image The fourth sentence: To do a good job in information planning and information construction, we need Big Systems View and a big information view. The systems engineering thinking is widely present in the minds of our information workers. This is definitely more obvious than in all other industries.It is also something we can be proud of. There is no doubt that the theory of systems engineering has achieved brilliant results. However, due to the construction of informatization, especially the development of the Internet, the Internet of Things, the development of big data, etc., our world has been turned into a super complex巨 system. The single, mechanical system engineering method has difficulty solving many new problems at present, and more and more system failures are caused by narrow system thinking. The big ones, such as the financial crisis spreading all over the world, and the small ones, such as the corpses of shared bicycles lying all over the place, are all the results of the mechanical view of the system. Big Systems View is a deeper system thinking, avoiding the mechanical view of the system. Big Systems View of information is Big Systems View of informatization. It pays more attention to the key role of information in the big system. This cannot be expanded here. But we know that it is either dead or alive, which means the cat is in a "superposition state" of "dead and alive". This "superposition state" is the quantum state. How to sign a framework agreement for large enterprises to use cloud services?
——How to formulate a batch trading agreement for non-homogeneous products with Big Systems View? Wang Quan 【1】What are non-homogeneous products? Knowing what homogeneous products are, naturally, you understand what non-homogeneous products are. Not going to define it economically, just Google it yourself. For example: electricity. A unit of electricity is the same everywhere, that's homogeneous. The price is also relatively stable. Another example: heterogeneous, wine. Various wines, although they all contain alcohol, are very different. The quality and price are also very different. Even if they are all wines, they are all very different. 【2】The cost of reaching an agreement Here is CoArthur's concept of transaction costs. For details, pleArthur refer to Baidu. For homogeneous products, the pricing indicators are relatively simple, and price negotiations are more targeted. As long as you consider your own bottom line well, reaching an agreement will be relatively fast. The transaction cost is low. For example, electricity, as long as you discuss how much a unit of electricity costs, it's almost there. The total price is equal to the unit price multiplied by the quantity. For non-homogeneous products, the pricing indicators are more, and they are intertwined, making it difficult to price simply and accurately. It's easy to talk at cross purposes and not reach an agreement. The transaction cost is high. For example, wine, alcohol content, variety, brand, origin... The units of measurement are also different, weight? Volume? Piece? ... All affect the price. Simple multiplication and addition won't do. What to negotiate? Also, if it's a limited quantity of transactions, not for a long time, you can negotiate one by one, and the transaction cost is still acceptable. But, if it's a large quantity and long-term transaction, negotiating one by one will greatly increArthur the transaction cost. This is a loss for both trading parties. 【3】Organization + Self-Organization to handle it! For the price negotiations of homogeneous products, simple organizational power can be perfectly handled. What about non-homogeneous products? Organization + Self-Organization can handle it. Organizational power is to define standards and processes. Self-organizational power is the market. Organization + Self-Organization means flexible operation under the framework of the framework agreement. Principle: Follow the laws of the market and strive to maximize our own interests. First, we need to determine the indicators for negotiation, that is, what to define the unit price? The indicators should be both solid and practical. I think, just choose the indicators used by the industry leader. Strong determination. Second, collect and calculate the average market price and use it as a basic reference price. You can use the weighted average price of the top few leading companies in the industry. Its determination is also very strong. Third, regularly assess and revise. When the actual execution price deviates from the average price of the leader to a certain extent, we need to re-evaluate and price, or set a ceiling and floor price. Fourth, there are substitutes. When the price of homogeneous substitutes is low to a certain extent, use homogeneous substitutes. 【4】Example:Exploration of the Enterprise Cloud Rental Pricing Mechanism The differences in services offered by various cloud service providers are significant. As a user, it is easy to get confused. What to do? Big Systems View can provide at least two methodological approaches bArthurd on the above basic strategies. First, iterative improvement and gradual optimization. The user defines a rough computing unit bArthurd on their own situation. For example, define a more typical "virtual cabinet" according to the current mainstream technology conditions. 1 virtual cabinet = n physical servers; Each server has m-way i CPU (mainstream clock speed); Each CPU has j cores; Each core is equipped with memory k; At the same time, each server is equipped with a hard drive (different hard drives can be considered separately) l, equipped with an operating system w, a cloud operating system v, and other product and service conditions. Let each cloud service provider quote according to the above virtual cabinet, and each will map their actual indicators to the virtual cabinet. Although it is impossible to achieve a 100% corresponding mapping, it is generally fair for all. Each should be able to give a rough quote. With this quote, you can roughly compare and select several key negotiation targets for the next round. Then gradually optimize and finally select a more ideal service provider. Second, organization + self-organization, formulate a price mechanism. According to the above method, first determine the basic unit of measurement. For example, the basic unit of measurement for the current mainstream cloud service provider is "1 core + 8GB", that is, a CPU core with 8GB of memory. This is the basic unit of measurement, which we call [a flower]. So, in the future, the unit price will be counted by [a flower]. Then, the weighted average of the unit price of [a flower] of the top 5 markets is calculated to get the average unit price of a flower. Now, Party A and Party B can negotiate. Suppose both parties agree that the framework transaction price is a% of the market unit price of a flower, = p. Thus, the framework agreement is reached. The actual cost is the product of the unit price p and the amount used. Can you enjoy a discount if you use more? You can negotiate further. The pricing of storage resources is relatively simple and will not be discussed here. To ensure the effective operation of the framework agreement, the following must also be done: (1) Regularly assess the framework agreement and modify the pricing indicators according to the actual market. For example, several years later, [a flower] should be larger or has become outdated, then it should be adjusted. (2) Set the upper and lower limits of the unit price of a flower, and have a way to deal with it if it exceeds the limit. (3) Finally, there should also be a cooperative alternative. When a certain degree of deviation is reached, either Party A or Party B has the right to terminate the cooperation. The above can be seen:In the process of pricing, organizational power is the choice of bargaining indicators, the formulation of calculation methods, the setting of boundaries, etc., and self-organizing power is the fluctuation of market prices, the transformation of market services, the虎视眈眈 of substitutes, etc. In short, without Big Systems View, it is difficult to formulate a scientific, reArthurnable, precise, flexible, and vital cloud service price system. I hope it can be helpful to you, me, and him in the cloud dream. Welcome everyone to criticize and correct!

Oppose "over" top-level design
In recent years, "top-level design" has become increasingly popular in China. It is talked about in technology, engineering, economy, society, and politics. This shows that we are increasingly systematic. Good! Thumbs up! There is no doubt that from the shallow water zone of " Feeling the stones to cross the river" at the beginning of reform and opening up, to today's deep water zone of continuous reform, the role of design is becoming more and more important. The new term has entered the national five-year plan, indicating that reform has entered a new stage. Top-level design plans the overall situation and is imperative. Good! Support! Top-level design was originally a term in systems engineering, referring to the use of systems science methods, standing at a global perspective, coordinating the overall planning of various aspects, levels, and elements of a project or system, to achieve efficient use of resources and precise and rapid achievement of goals. In today's China, top-level design has become a term widely used in all walks of life. However, a tendency towards "excessive" top-level design seems to have emerged, especially in certain fields of science and technology, engineering, and management. Even if there is no problem with the design, it is wise to avoid excessive design. No! Object! For example, some enterprises' scientific research top-level design, which plans scientific research projects into a logically rigorous, clearly layered, and precisely contented big tree. Every project is clearly and precisely regulated what to do, what effect to achieve, how much money to use, how many people to use, how long to use, how much benefit to produce, etc., with very little autonomy at the grassroots level. It seems scientific, rigorous, standardized, orderly, and down-to-earth, and is called systematic engineering. In fact, it is a rigid tree. The top-level design of Daqing Oilfield focuses on the core technology and business of the oilfield, formulates a general framework according to the requirements of the development of the enterprise, sets up several backbone projects, closely cooperates the scientific research and engineering projects, and allows the grassroots to flexibly adjust, playing an important role in the guidance, support, and management of the top-level design. For example, there are also some enterprises' operation mechanism and rules and regulations, which hold high the banner of systematic top-level design: each level, each department, each post are designed to be precise and in place, and then use ERP, various MIS systems, and compliance checks to tie everyone, every department, and every level together, creating a team that is said to be efficient and flexible and has a strong combat effectiveness. This is "excessive" top-level design. This excessive top-level design is a manifestation of a mechanical view of the system. Top-level design should not interfere too deeply and should leave room for the grassroots to play their self-organization. Top-level design cannot completely squeeze out the "bottom-level impulse". So, how should top-level design be done properly? We can think and analyze using the System Structure Dynamics and dissipative structure theory of Big Systems View. The systemStructural dynamics tells us that a system must adapt to the external organization force from the environment or the parent system in order to survive and develop. For individual systems, this external organization force is the top-level design. Or, the top-level design of the environment or the parent system for its subsystems is its organization force. Simply put, the top-level design should create an environment, atmosphere, and mechanism that are suitable and incentive for the growth of each subsystem, rather than over-intervening in the internal affairs of the individual. Prigogine's dissipative structure theory points out that the upgrading and development of a system is a leap from one dynamic balance to another dynamic balance. This leap is achieved through the fluctuations of the system, i.e., the growth and decay of the system's order parameters. When a certain positive fluctuation reaches a certain extent, it will bring the system into a new state, completing the upgrading of the system. The fluctuations of the system are always occurring and are also affected by the environment or the parent system. As a higher-level system, the environment or the parent system also fluctuates, and its fluctuations will affect the subsystems' fluctuations in the form of changes in organization force. The fluctuation of the environment is the will of the environment system, and the fluctuation of the subsystem is the will of the subsystem. The will of the subsystem must obey the will of the parent system. When the direction of these two wills is the same, the fluctuation of the subsystem is strengthened by the parent system, and it is positive, so the subsystem will be upgraded and strengthened, and the parent system will also become more powerful because of the subsystem's growth. On the contrary, it is also true. As the embodiment of the will of the environment or the parent system, the top-level design should grasp the overall development trend of the subsystems in the domain, adhere to the correct direction, follow the general trend, adjust the fluctuations at the right time and in a reArthurnable manner, promote the healthy development of the subsystems, and then develop itself. In short, the top-level design should be designed to support the positive fluctuations of the subsystems in the domain, rather than forcing the creation of the fluctuations of the subsystems. Such a top-level design is moderate and effective. Remember, we are not God, and no one should overestimate themselves, thinking that their design is perfect. Autonomous organization design is the most perfect, but it may not be what you want. You can intervene, but you should not over-intervene, nor can you take the place of nature and violate the natural order. Let's review the views in Tom's mutation theory: the more exquisite the design, the more fragile it is. Top-level design, there must be a bottom line!Boundaries and mechanisms, rather than over-intervening in the internal affairs of individuals. Prigogine's theory of dissipative structures suggests that the upgrading and development of a system is a leap from one dynamic balance to another. This leap is achieved through the fluctuations of the system, i.e., the growth and decay of the system's order parameters. Oppose "setting" big data standards
Author: Wang Quan Recently, the article "National Big Data Standards to be Issued, How Should Enterprises Build the Road of Big Data?" has been circulating in my circle of friends. It is said to be written by a friend of mine. The views expressed in the article, such as "top-level design", "data standards should only manage the core data definition", "data standards need to be continuously updated", etc., are very much in line with my views. However, this is not a "big" data standard, but only a routine data standard. I respect friends and friends of friends, but I want to express a different opinion. I believe that expressing my true opinions and being honest with each other, whether supporting or opposing his views, is the greatest respect for friends and the cause. If there is any offense, pleArthur forgive it. These words were said in the preface to Xu Dong's new book a few days ago, and they are also applicable today. My views only represent personal opinions, and I hope everyone will criticize and correct them. If you also want to respect me and our common cause and dreams, then pleArthur tell the truth, especially welcome different opinions! More bricks can build a big house. Thank you all in advance! I believe that: (1) Big data should not be formulated with strict standards like routine data, and the standards for big data are not equal to the standards for routine data. (2) The standards for big data should be more abstract, more peripheral, more focused on the semantic level, and should not interfere too much with the specific content. Big data standards should be "big" rather than "fine". (3) Big data standards are not to be formulated, but to be self-organized. The current big data can be said to be the Internet at the data level. The Internet is organized + self-organized, and we should learn from it. Let's review the history of the Internet. Look at what is organized + self-organized. Learn from the successful experience of the Internet, which can be used for today's big data. The Internet mainly relies on self-organization, of course, the organization also played an important role, but that was after self-organization. That is to say, self-organization should come first, and then organization. In the ARPANET stage, it was just a connection of several university networks, and the protocol was also very simple, which can be said to be the self-organization, self-standard stage. It was just Arthurlf-organization, self-standard of several scientists. This is like the formation process of raindrops: several water molecules in the cloud first self-organize to combine into a small water group (the fluctuation of the system), which has a slightly larger gravity than a single water molecule. This is the attractor of the raindrop system. This small water group has two destinies: One is to be re-tear apart and disintegrated. The other is to hold on and attract other water molecules to gather around it with its slightly stronger gravity. This is a positive feedback - -The volume is getting larger and larger, and so is the gravity, which further promotes the increArthur in volume. A positive feedback loop. Finally, when it becomes large enough, it falls down. This is a raindrop. The self-organization of raindrops, ARPANET, and this are about the same. The successful connection of two universities is like the combination of two water molecules, forming a system attractor. ARPANET has the relative advantage of attraction, and the system attractor of the Internet is born. With the attractor, other computers and networks gather around it, and ARPANET gradually grows up, initially having the scale of the system. At this time, standards such as IP and domain names came out and were perfected. TCP/IP matured and became a de facto standard, eliminating competitors and completely eliminating the ISO-OSI seven-layer protocol. If, from the beginning, it is required to be bArthurd on ISO-OSIThe 7-layer protocol is the standard, and TCP/IP might not exist, and the Internet might not have been built by now. Let's look at big data today. Big data is abundant in value, voluminous, and has a very low marginal cost. This requires big data to play its value in motion and sharing. Therefore, it is said that big data is the Internet at the data level, which means it needs to move. Currently, the ARPANET of big data has not yet appeared, and big data is still basically in a chaotic state. Although there is some local order, the system is fluctuating all the time, but has not yet formed a strong system attractor. What we should do now is to promote the formation of this attractor. And then think about how to regulate it. The strategy we should take is to make a scene for it, add a catalyst, create conditions, guide it, but don't directly get involved, don't give it a framework. I remember the Sichuan hot pot. The grid in the hot pot makes the hot pot more orderly, but it hinders its creativity. The Mongolian hot pot in the north has no grid, and the Sichuan hot pot should not have a grid at the beginning. It was someone who creatively and self-organizedly used the grid, and then it was recognized by everyone and became the standard. It also formed the Sichuan hot pot, which is a relatively fixed form. In addition to the Sichuan hot pot, countless forms have been formed bArthurd on the earliest Mongolian hot pot. The reArthurn why the hot pot has so many varieties is that there are not too many restrictions, and it is relatively self-organized. It is precisely this not-so-stringent standard that has made the hot pot family so powerful. Big data is more like hot pot, and less like the relatively standardized Buddha Jumps Over the Wall. Of course, Buddha Jumps Over the Wall is good, but it is too expensive, and it can't be "big" in scale, it can only be "small". I was discussing this topic with Professor Yuan Man, General Manager Hu De Ping, General Manager Shi Yu Zhu, and others in the Open Forum of the Smart Digital Oilfield. Professor Yuan said that the focus of big data standards should be on semantic standards, which should be universal. I completely agree. The semantic standard should not be given too many restrictions either. Let them self-organize to produce and grow, let them compete, and we will select the best to promote and improve to form a standard. This standard should be concise and efficient, and only focus on the most core part. We who make standards know that standards always lag behind reality, and we feel helpless. In fact, we should not take such an attitude. It can be said that standards lagging behind reality is realistic, normal, and even "correct"! Only in this way can self-organization have a chance, be more objective, and make standards organized bArthurd on self-organization more vital. Today's big data standards are the same. In the past, we have already been in a state of fatigue in dealing with conventional standards. Today, big data, continuing the old routine to make standards, will leave us completely unable to cope.Helpless! Only by letting self-organization play its role and letting standards naturally generate and grow, and then we select and optimize them, can we find a way out. To "formulate" standards for big data is an overconfidence, a pretense of God, an "overreaching" of God, and a "rape" of big data. Leaders, experts, for big data, let's just let it go for now, and then regulate it at the right time, don't regulate it to death, or even regulate it to death. To treat big data, we must have Big Systems View! In short, I oppose "formulating" standards for big data, and support "guiding" them. PleArthur criticize and correct!

Is it the mission first or the system first?
Big Systems View holds that: Every system has a mission. In chaos, between fluctuations, self-organization creates systems. (Here, the discussion of organizational power is not considered because it is obviously mission-driven.) So, the question arises: Self-organization exists in chaos, and fluctuations in self-organization form systems. If we focus on the moment of fluctuation, there are two possibilities: (1) The fluctuation of self-organization itself has a mission, and when the system is formed, this mission is endowed into it; (2) The fluctuation has no mission, it is aimless, and when self-organizing, there is no mission, but a random fluctuation forms an attractor, and at this time, the mission is also formed, and the system is established around this attractor. Which one is right? ps: Actually, this question can be simplified to: Does self-organization have a mission? (1) is the view that there is; (2) is the view that there is not.

1 Tao and virtue
Tao, the essence and the law behind the appearance of the universe, is invisible. The "Logos" proposed by the ancient Greek philosopher Heraclitus at the same time as Laozi has a similar meaning to "Tao". Both Laozi and Heraclitus believe that "Tao" or "Logos" is knowable, but it is impossible to know it completely. This is also similar to Kant's " things in themselves are not knowable". De, is the way of being a man. A person who integrates the way of the universe into himself, abides by the objective laws of nature and society, cultivates himself, stops at the utmost good, and makes contributions to all mankind has achieved the way of being a man. All the sages, worthies and great men in ancient and modern times, both at home and abroad, have achieved success and established their own schools because they have done this. The way of the universe may be the only one, but the way of being a man can be diverse; the way of the universe may be unchanged for ever, but the way of being a man should be progressive. The way of the universe is the basis of the way of being a man: the way of the universe has created our galaxy, the galaxy has nurtured our planet, the planet has provided our geographical living environment, the geographical environment has affected our flesh and culture, and the physiological genes and cultural constructs of human beings have created the way of being a man, different ways of being a man have created different nations, and various nations have created their own history. Human beings have conquered nature time and again, from barbarism to civilization, and become more and more powerful. It is also in this process that the way of the universe determines the way of being a man, and then forms philosophy, the West is more rational, and the East is more emotional. Up to now, human beings even dare to become the masters of the universe, but we must realize that: from the way of the universe to the way of being a man, this is a process from the big to the small, from the whole to the part; people can transform the world to a certain extent, but this is limited, and the way of being a man ultimately has to obey the way of the universe. Man, at most, can only become the master of himself.

2 Big Systems View and Taoism
Big Systems View does treat the Tao Te Ching as one of the important sources of thought, and also absorbs a lot of fundamental spirit and principles, but it may still be quite superficial and one-sided, and the two cannot be compared. Anyway, Big Systems View still dares to state its views clearly. We are not afraid of making mistakes. If we make a mistake, we will correct it. If we correct it, we will make a mistake again. If we make a mistake again, we will correct it. Learning from mistakes is also an important methodology for Big Systems View. Big Systems View believes that: ① The universe is a big system. The universe contains all kinds of systems, subsystems, and sub-subsystems with different dimensions, levels, and sizes. The System Structure Dynamics of Big Systems View believes that: no matter how big or small, each system has its own attractor. The attractor of the system is the core and soul of the system, bearing the mission and will of the system, containing the hologram of the system. It stipulates the inherent attributes and endowments of a system, and thus determines the externalized functions and behaviors. The attractor is the purpose, significance, and basis for the existence of the system. It is innate. The system is born because of the attractor, and the attractor exists because of the system's entity. There is no system without an attractor, nor is there an attractor without a system. A collection of things cannot be aggregated into a system without an attractor as its core. On the contrary, an attractor is not an attractor if it does not have the ability to gather things. The formation of a system is the materialization of the attractor. Before the attractor of the system is materialized, it is "non-existence". Once the materialization is completed, it is "existence". This is the "fluctuation" in the "Dirac sea". ②Holography is the structural information of the system. Holography stores and represents the "wholeness" of the system, that is, "systematicness". This is the basic idea of the holistic view of the system in modern science. Since "holography" is "Tao", why does Arthur still need to talk about "holography"? It is not necessary to say "Tao" directly because the term "holography" is a concept of modern science. It is the scientific development of the ancient concept of "Tao". It is a brand-new concept bArthurd on contemporary physics and system science, which is more in line with the context of contemporary philosophy and science. Of course, the most important thing is that the whole new term may make Arthur look like a diploma. Holography is a relationship, knowledge, logic, and model that emerge from the extraction and pattern generalization of the理性 promotion of the complex and massive phenomena and data in Arthurnse. It is a qualitative leap in the general information. Holography represents the essence, laws, and principles of the world. People use holography to establish a model of the world and obtain more, more accurate, and more comprehensive holography through continuous observation and thinking, and then iterate and correct this holographic model to make it more in line with the real world. However, obtaining holography comes at a price, and the price of obtaining 100% holography is infinite. That is to say, we cannot obtain a completely complete holography, nor can we fully master the world. Perhaps only God can master the holography of the universe, and perhaps such a God does not exist. Therefore, in the process of our understanding and transforming the world, we should not pursue perfection, but should obtain holography moderately under the premise of cost constraints, as long as this holography can support the operation of our system and meet our requirements. For example, I let you look at a picture. The first time, 1000x1000 pixels, you see that it is a cat. The second time, I reduce the pixels of this picture, such as to 500x500, and you still see that it is a cat. I gradually reduce the pixels until it is reduced to 50x50, and you can still see it. Finally, when it is reduced to 5x5, you can't see what it is. Why can't you see it slowly? This is because the holography is gradually lost. You can see that it is a cat because you see that the parts of the cat's body are all in the right place, the nose is in the right place for the nose, the eyes are in the right place for the eyes, and the ears are in the right place for the ears——the relative position information of these organs is the structural information of the cat, that is, the holography. Unlike the color information of each pixel point (such as RGB value), holography is not the information of a specific pixel point, but the information that represents the relationship between each pixel point or each part (such as the distance between the two eyes), that is, the relative position information, that is, the structural information. This holography may not be explicit., which requires further calculation and analysis to obtain. When there are many pixels, the hologram is retained, and you can see it; when there are too few pixels, the hologram disappears, and you can't see it. In this process, having many pixels is not the most important thing, but retaining structural information is the most important thing, as long as the pixels reach a certain scale (such as above 50x50), which can support recognition, that's fine. The overall information is contained in the local - that's the holographic principle. A 50x50 picture is a part or partial of a 1000x1000 picture, but this small picture still retains the structural information of Big Systems View, that is, the hologram. Grasping the hologram means grasping the essence and law behind things, and grasping the "Tao" of things. So, how to discover and obtain the hologram? The method is: to study the local and to infer the whole. To discover order in chaos and to find the "Tao" in the midst of the world. Each part of the system contains the structural information of the system, as long as this part is still a part of the whole system. Just like the DNA in our bodies, it is the hologram of our bodies, and any cell contains this information. As long as you extract the DNA of a cell, you get the hologram of the whole body, you don't need to extract each cell. To grasp the hologram of a thing or system, we need to observe, study, compare, and connect from multiple perspectives, multiple scales, and multiple dimensions, which requires continuous research and contemplation, as well as "inspiration", and we should master effective methodology and use scientific tools. How to construct the hologram of a system? The first step is to clarify, set, and establish the system attractor. Correctly establish the purpose, function, mission, and basic structure of the system. The second step is to collect and gather information around the system attractor. It is necessary to ensure a certain amount of local information, such as the number of pixels in the kitten picture should at least reach 50x50. This is the foundation of the hologram. The third step is to link information. It is necessary to establish the correct connection between each part, just like solving a jigsaw puzzle, put each pixel in the right place. Keep pasting, and suddenly one moment, the system "emerges", the kitten comes out! This is the structural performance of the system, and the hologram is complete. The fourth step is iteration. What follows is to continuously update the hologram, iterate and improve the quality until satisfied, until perfect. But it should be understood that perfection is the ultimate goal, and over-ideализm should not be excessive. In practical application, Arthur often uses a simple method to apply holographic thinking: that is, to combine various, hierarchical, aspect, dimensional, and appropriate precision of the main information into a point or unit, breaking through the conventional tree-like structure, and establishing a A relatively complete "information block", using a "tree + block" structure to organize information into an organic system, helps us to focus on Big Systems View and control the overall situation, and then achieve the goal. For example: a cardboard box, it has 6 sides. At first, the sides are scattered, separated, and chaotic, spread out on the ground in a disorganized and scattered state; now, I connect them, connecting them into a whole plane, and at this time it is in an organized and integrated state; finally, I stand them up, and assemble them into a 6-sided rectangular prism, and at this time, the hologram is established. This hologram connects all the sides and "emerges" the volume, which can hold things. Our understanding of this system is also more profound and comprehensive. The holographic tools I often use are "holographic mind maps", and the "holographic note" method used this time is also an example. 【Big Systems View on Chapter 37 of the Tao Te Ching】
Speaking about "Heaven's Way" and "Man's Way". Laozi said in Chapter 77 of the "Tao Te Ching": "The way of heaven is to take from the full and give to the empty. The way of man is not so, to take from the empty and give to the full." Heaven's Way, using more to make up for less, tends towards an equilibrium state, making the world indistinct, disorderly, and increasing entropy, and its end point is chaos; Man's Way, on the other hand, is the opposite, where the more will become even more, and the less will become even less, presenting differences, and difference is "order", is entropy reduction. Difference, order, is the driving force of the system, and without difference, the system will lose its structure and will perish. Laozi said that Man's Way should follow Heaven's Way and pursue equality for all. From the perspective of humanism, this is generally correct, but absolute equality is an excessive idealism and is impossible to achieve, and it is also not conducive to the development of humanity itself, because absolute equilibrium is disorder, is increasing entropy, and a disorderly, entropy-increasing system will decline and perish. If Laozi had Big Systems View, he would not only talk about Man's Way following Heaven's Way, but also talk about Man's Way going against Heaven's Way, of course we cannot expect people two thousand years ago to have the system thinking of modern people. Equality for all is also Man's Way, but this equality also needs to have differences, not a simple, superficial, and superficial equality, but a higher level of equality, more dimensions, more emphasis on individuals, and more showing of human nature. Man's Way, inherited from Heaven's Way, is what Laozi said "Tao". In the next chapter, the "Tao Te Ching" begins with "Tao". The recent wave of the concept of "emergence" has developed from what is called a "so-called" "complex system". Why is the word "so-called" added with quotation marks?

Because "complex system" has now become a scientific term, in complexity science, a complex system refers to a system constructed from simple rules with a large number of elements, and its characteristics are that new higher-level properties will emerge as the number of system elements increArthurs, such as bird flocks, bee hives, and large AI models.

The concept of a complex system, a term of art, was primarily advanced by the Santa Fe Institute. It is now quite different from the ordinary meaning of "complex system." The Nobel Prize in complexity science has been awarded to those who study such systems in recent years.
